This is a fun show.
The main character, Mogami Kyouko, is one of the best shoujo heroines to pop up in a long time. I adored her dual personality--she swings between being an innocent, sweet, caring girl to a vindictive, bitter one at the drop of a hat! Her facial expressions are a riot, too, especially her chibi ones.
Unlike so many heroines of this genre, Kyouko's motivation for seeking greatness in showbiz is revenge, not love. Of course, revenge is never a good motivation, and a fair portion of Kyouko's character development involves her learning to love and trust people again, or at least to learnto enjoy acting for its own sake.


The rest of the main characters are equally enjoyable. Japanese voice actor Miyano Mamoru (Light from Death Note, Tamaki from Ouran HSHC) is absolutely perfect as as Shoutaro--the character's arrogance, massive ego, and adolescent attitudes are fully on display whenever he speaks. Kyouko's eventual love interest, Tsuruga Ren, voiced by the always-fantastic Konishi Katsuyuki (Kamina from Gurren Lagann, Soubi from Loveless, Hisagi from Bleach), is frankly one of the hottest bishounen to appear on screen in recent memory. He's a fully developed character too, with his own flaws and foibles. Interestingly enough, the viewer sees a good quantity of the action from his point of view, which makes him a refreshing change from the mysterious, aloof bishie that one often sees in shoujo anime. Kyouko's friend, "Mouko" and Ren's manager, Yashiro, are fine additions to the anime's cast as well.


That is not to say this anime is without flaws. The animation is rather poor, and the frame rate is embarrassingly low. Of course, there really isn't enough action in this show to really merit a high animation budget, but at least they could have used fewer still-frame shots and included a little more detail in the sparse character designs. It also seems like that the animators, every time they could, replaced the backgrounds with pink shoujo sparkles and reduced the characters to chibi forms just to save drawing effort.


The anime suffers from major pacing problems as well. The show progresses at a crawl, lingering much too long on unimportant events (like the mini-arc involving the little bratty girl) instead of progressing the plot or Kyouko's relationship with Ren. The ending (don't worry, no spoilers here) leaves something to be desired, too, as it cuts out in the middle of one of the manga arcs. It makes me wish they'd hurried up more in the beginning so they could have at least finished the storyline (perhaps they were hoping for a second season...?).


Anyway, overall this anime is worth watching. The characters, plot, and over-the-top humor simply make up for whatever compositional flaws there are.


And for those of you who've finished the anime and are looking for more, definitely pick up the manga. It eats the anime for lunch.

Skip Beat is definitely one of my favorite anime shows. I honestly don't normally like most shoujo anime, but Skip Beat is different. This show is on my top 5 because it has a fantastic storyline, fantastic characters, and nonstop excitement. On top of that, it has romance as well...with a twist. Kyoko practically loses her ability to love after being betrayed by the only guy she ever loved. She had basically devoted her life to him so, on that fateful day when she is betrayed, it sets her loose. Kyoko stops being a sweet, innocent girl and goes into show business as Fuwa Shotaro(the guy she liked) already is a popular singer. She stops at nothing to try to outshine Sho. He was cruel and now, he needs to pay in her eyes.  What will it take? Will Kyoko be able to rise to the top? Can she really win when she only desires revenge? Watch the anime, read the manga, Skip Beat is fantastic!



The story~

The story is excellent and very unique.  Kyoko basically becomes a popular actress because she wants to get revenge on Sho.  It starts off like this, but then she changes.  Acting becomes her passion, and it's not all about revenge anymore (although she still hates Sho haha).  She builds a new life for herself in a way, with new relationships and more.

Art~

For art, I must say this is the lowest point of the anime/manga.  The men all have weird, pointy chins although the girls look decent.  Honestly though, besides the chins, everything is pretty ok xP.

Sound~

8

There is lovely music and it always fits the different scenes.  Don't have much to say, but the op/ed was better than average.

Characters~

Wow, the characters are something else.  Kyoko, Sho, Ren and everyone else become so developed throughout the show.  Hopefully, the anime will continue because they grow even more in the manga.  The characters are original and thoroughly enjoyable.  Even the villains end up fascinating you and aren't extremely cliche and boring.

Enjoyment~

Overall, I absolutely ADORE this anime.  I recommend this show to anybody who is looking something different from the typical, boring shoujo.  Skip Beat is on my top 5 for a reason! ;O

The anime is amazing. The characters are learning some lesson throughout the story like learning to love or to move on if something doesn't go your way. The advice they put through the story somehow fits with reality. I don't really find the ending of the show that great but the rest of the story is extremely amazing and fits with the plot. I can't say i loved it but i did enjoy it and liked it, and i recommend you watch it.

Ah...Skip Beat...what can I say about you, except that you're probably THE most enjoyable anime I've ever watched. If you've ever jumped into an anime, not expecting much of anything from it, so ready to drop it (I was NOT a big fan of the art at first) and yet after watching a few minutes of the first episode you knew you couldn't for any reason pull away? Well that's how I felt watching Skip Beat! I saw this a while back, but I've currently started reading the manga, so I thought I'd give it a review.
Story:
The story is one of revenge. Kyouko is devotedto her childhood friend Shou and thus tries to help him out on his quest to become famous. But Shou is a jerk of epic proportions and he mistreats Kyouko to the point she can't take it anymore. She decides she'll get revenge on him for all he's done and how he's made her 'lose her youth.' She decides entering show biz and becoming an even bigger star than him is the way to go. Along the way she learns a couple of important lessons, growing and changing as she tries to make it to the top. It's really not the most outlandish story line out there but I don't think it's the most common either. Even if the story line wasn't solid, it's the trials and tribulations of Kyouko and her UBER awesome personality that makes this anime solid.


Art:

I was a bit turned off by the art to the point I almost didn't watch it, but I decided to at least give the first episode a look-see and I was hooked. I've learned to feel comfortable with the art and I've come to feel it fits the characters just right.


Sound:

I don't pay much attention, so either way, good or bad, I wouldn't know XD


Character:

Kyouko is the solid lead of this anime and by all means it stands on her shoulders alone. She's not your typical weak, crybaby, shojo anime heroine. She's strong, independent, hard-working and strong-willed. Plus, she has a wicked vengeful, 'I'll kick your ---- any day!' kind of attitude. But at the same time she's pure-hearted and deep down she's really just someone who wants to be loved and accepted, whether she understands that herself or not. Plus, she's hilarious. The first episode alone has her whipping out like 100000 facial expressions that are just drop dead funny. That's another thing that makes her great, she's sooooo expressive. You're never at odds about what she's thinking. YOU JUST KNOW. The other characters are great as well, each having a personality that, although seems very shallow, is in fact quite multi-faceted. But one thing is always evident, it seems Kyouko is always the one bringing out the best in everyone. 


Enjoyment:

I don't usually laugh out loud at anime... to be perfectly honest, even if it's actually funny, I'll laugh on the inside. BUT I couldn't do that with Skip Beat. It was non-stop LOL-ness, to the point people were staring and thinking I was weird. I can truly say, if you're into this sort of anime, you'll be laughing your tail off too. It's just a fun anime. And you can't help but relate to Kyouko and feel everything she's feeling. 


Overall:

I'd say, for shojo anime lovers out there, this is the best I've seen. And I'm sure you'll enjoy it, even if not as much as I did.

I fell in love with the manga and ended up watching the anime afterwards because I just couldn't get enough of it. That being said, I was highly disappointed with the anime adaptation, and felt like the overall vibe was very different than the original manga (and no, I am not someone who automatically feels that the manga version of any story is superior).  It's difficult for me to pinpoint exactly why I loved the manga and hated the adaptation, but I'll try. 
Plotwise, the anime more or less follows the story. Parts were shortened and some scenes eliminated, but nothing that really stoodout at me. However, the anime ENDS right about when the manga starts to get good and the characters start to develop. Skip Beat is a long a** manga (too long some might say - I love it but the mangaka does drag it on for quite a while), and the anime just barely scratches the surface, and leaves more loose ends that it resolves (honestly, if I only saw the anime without reading the manga at first, I would be confused and frustrated since there are so many things that are never explained or reseolved). One of my favorite aspects of the manga was how Kyoko and Ren's career in acting was incorporated in the story (especially seeing how Kyoko grew as an actor and changed for each role that she played), but that was not explored nearly as much in the anime. 


The anime also emphasized some of my least favorite aspects of the original story, in a way that made the story seem much more cliche and Kyoko much more annoying. Kyoko comes across as much more over-the-top in the anime, and bent on revenge with not as many characteristics to make her rounded out (a LOT of her character development is also left out since the anime ends so prematurely). The pacing of the how Kyoko's relationship with Ren develops was also a lot faster, which makes it somewhat boring to me since you don't see as much of a transition from hate to apathy to friends to romantic interest. 


The art was terrible. Very plain scenes that lacked in detail, angular and unattractive character designs, way too much chibi...maybe some of the worst art that i've come across in quite a while. 


Overall. I would say that this was a very dull and cliche adaptation with uninspiring artwork and annoying characters. I wouldn't go so far as to say that it's not worth watching if you like the genre - it's alright, and maybe I might have liked it more if I hadn't read the manga beforehand and knew what I was missing out on. That being said, if watching this anime leaves you feeling unfulfilled, I highly recommend that you read the source material.

The reason I enjoyed this anime is because of the main character. After learning that her love interest was using her, she doesn't break down and cry and pity herself, but she takes some action and decides to take revenge on him by going into showbusiness.
Story (7)
The story might seem a but ridiculous at times ( for example she got into the LME agency way too easily with no talent really). I was also disappointed with the Love Me section as it was forgotten really easily and wasn't really mentioned anymore. It kind of seemed useless at the end, but at the end of theday I was really cheering for the main character to suceed and was looking forward to see how she will deal with various kinds of things.


Art (5)

I didn't really enjoyed art in this series. Sometimes the animation of movement didn;t work at all ( for example when driving, the buldings in the background looked soo cartoony [ on top of that the Porshe was just ugly (And i love cars).


Sound (7)


Character (9)

I loved the main character. I liked how she wasn;t a typical anime heroine which just cries the whole time after her love interest dumps her. What can I say, she had balls.

I enjoyed side characters too especially Ren.


Overall I really enjoyed this series and recommend anyone to give it a go.

After finishing Kaichou wa Maid-sama and Special A, I was looking for another show that would give me the same flavor.  I saw Skip Beat! in the list of recommendations so I thought to try it.  Then I read the synopsis and kind of put it on the back-burner.  The concept of a girl struggling for revenge and all that drama kind of switched off my interest.  Yes, I passed judgement on this show prematurely.  My mistake, because this show just blew me away.  It was exactly what I was looking for and then some.
The story was great.The show does have drama, but the comedy does balance it out.  As for the art, it wasn't anything outstanding but I'm not complaining.  I never felt turned off by it and the characters designs were fine by me.  Same thing with the sound.  The music was okay and nothing really grabbed me but it wasn't bad.  But what really makes this show great is the characters.  Hey, it's shoujo, and the characters are predictable.  You have the pretty boys, the plain girl, the rivals and what not.  But the voice acting, especially for the main character, was fantastic.  I was rooting for Kyoko from episode 1.  She is such a likeable character that, in a way, was a breath of fresh air to me.  I had just finished Maburaho and the hero in that show annoyed me to no end.  But Kyoko on other hand, wasn't so static.  She is a good girl but wants revenge.  And that vengeful streak often rears up unexpectedly, that it had me laughing.  There are tense moments in the show that build up and this kept me hooked, so that I watched episode after episode just to find out what happened next.  The ending though, was a bit of a let down.  I wanted more; some kind of closure to this wild ride but it just didn't properly appear to me.  Nevertheless, all that led up to the ending was so enjoyable that I can definitely overlook the ending.\n\n
I don't buy a lot of anime.  Why?  Cause I'm a guy and I recently got married.  I always wonder what my wife would think if she found out that I was watching all these girly shows.  But this show is just too good that I'm going to buy it.  Then I'll slip it in the DVD player and win her over to my side.  Or...would it be that I've gone over to her side?  Yup, I'll have to pick up a manly show as well just to even it out.

This shoujo coming-of-age is nothing you haven't seen before unless you started anime within the last month, but that doesn't necessarily mean it's not worth watching. Equal parts drama, romance and comedy as set in the world of showbiz, a typical charming lead that tries to make self-insertion easy scrapes up the ladder with a variety of virtues that play much better on screen than they ever would in real life, with important people regularly going out of their way for someone they barely know as she rises to the top. But that's par for the course and rarely detracts from the presentation.
Two points needto be made. Don't watch this if you're looking for music, there is none. I'd like a single in here somewhere, better yet two - dueling tracks from the male leads would be excellent. Kyoko isn't a singer, but an entertainment anime deserves some memorable music and the OP/ED don't provide.


Two, the acting scenes don't sell. Kyoko spontaneously and repeatedly transforms, almost magical-girl-style, into a premiere actress without any real training and at the drop of a hat. Fine, prodigies exist - but then the way she's written when she's supposed to be amazing doesn't resonate. 


The ending leaves a lot of space for a second season, an OVA, something, and I personally found it disappointing, but I can understand this decision and won't criticize, even if I would be surprised by a continuation. Outside from this, it's an entertaining ride that's worth a watch on a rainy Sunday or more generally if there's not a ton on your plate. If you like Twilight this is right up your alley, without the fanfiction aftertaste. 7 of 10.

Amazing, amazing, AMAZING! Skip was just amazing. I loved this anime because of all the drama...the feeling...the EMOTION...the acting! It was all so wonderful! 
The only thing I disliked was the ending. It was so....it was SO a cliffhanger! I was so angry but I've seen this whole anime twice because it's so amazing.

I am a little biased because this is my favourite shoujo anime of all time!!! 
The reason why this anime is so good is just because most female shoujo characters are very weak, shy and boring and only used as a tool to highlight how hot or amazing the guys are. But Skip Beat! is on another level in terms of the main characters.
Kyouko is just the funniest, strongest, and most surprising heroine I have ever seen, her character development will shock you and you will not believe how amazing she is in every way. She actually makes the guys seem less cool compared toher. It is refreshing to see a shoujo anime that emphasizes girl power. \n
The two main leads are also exceptionally interesting from other animes, and they all have extremely funny and heartwarming moments throughout. The characters are developed well in the 25 episodes.\n
If you are expecting a lot of intimate scenes, you will be disappointed as the intimacy between the characters moves incredibly slowly (even in the manga).\n
The only let-down would have to be the ending as it kind of ends on a cliff hanger. But that's probably because the manga is still ongoing. \n\n
Please give it a shot and I am sure you will be surprised :)

Short Review here - 
Recommended: For more Shojo lovers but yes!
Spoiler Free?: Kind of? Some spoilers.
Read Manga: Yes, unanswered ending.
Pros: THIS CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT! MHMMM! Also super funny!
Cons: Unanswered ending and not a complete romance
Best Character: Yukihito Yashiro because...he ships...
Swears in review: Yeaha
♥
In depth review is here:
First ep, I thought the anime was going to be trash! A classic female lead HUNG over on her male best friend. Then we learn that her best friend is has been using her as a stepping stone. Boom! That's when her character changed! She became a badass without weapons!
Though even though she is a new person she still gainedflaws for becoming that new person. And that flaw is lacking love, a common human emotion. \n\n
I say ep 10 and up were the best and we actually got to see her get all of these opportunities. The romance starts around ep-15 which was kind of slow but whatever. \n\n
Now one of the things that shined so brightly in this show was this character development. And they had the best type of character development! The character development was the kind we see in a lot of animes, characters wanting to better themselves or see how other work and gain inspiration to be like them. It's honestly super sweet.\n\n
This anime got me laughing out loud and honestly one of the sho-jo gems. \n
The romance is a SLOW-BURNER but it's worth it. Also we see a lot of bitchy characters but honestly...they weren't all that bad.\n\n
I love how they portrayed the acting as well. \n\n
Now one of the BIG problem I have with this show is... how do I put this.. THAT ENDING CLIFFHANGER! I get it is to push pepole to read the manga but... come on!\n\n
This is definitely an anime you should watch :).

skip beat has the most wonderful story...it includes a one girl that wants revenge on his past friend that has been a traitor of his life because of that boy named: (Fuwa Sho), because of that guy she lost an important part of the human life and it's love. Then she got unto showbiz to show his revenge on Fuwa Sho. But there's a man who's been knowing also a part of her life and its Tsuraga Ren. And that where she continue her journey on becoming a star by joining the LOVE ME department, to get back her feeling on love...

A story of vengeance embarks a girl's journey towards a life of fame. There is a slow pace of minimal character development but it's better than not having anything at all and there are some twists in the story that will make you feel good about watching it.
A highly recommended anime for people who loves to laugh while enjoying a romance anime with twists.

Skip beat is about a girl named Kyoko who has spent her whole life adoring and dedicating herself to a shallow bastard named Sho Fuwa and helping him pursue his dreams of becoming an idol.  
One day Kyoko overhears Sho saying he think of her as nothing but his “maid” and that she is a “plain and boring girl.” So what does she do? Cry? Get depressed? Crawl into a sad little ball and give up on life itself? 
HELL NO! Kyoko swears revenge on Sho and does this by getting into the showbiz industry herself! 
I FREAKING LOVE Kyoko's PERSONALITY! I may evenhave a girl crush on her, she's just that awesome! It's so refreshing to finally see a strong female main character. She's bold, full of spunk, hilarious and at times even a bit scary. \n\n
I really admire her for how she didn't let Sho steal her self-esteem and instead used her noble excuse for revenge to join his rivaling agency LME to get into the acting industry (and by god is she talented!) You just can’t help and cheer on this underdog as she faces the challenges to become an actor with the help of fellow actor Ren.\n\n
However like many anime, Skip Beat felt unfinished. There is a dying need of a second series! Lots of thing felt unresolved and I wanted to see more relationship development.\n\n
Overall, I recommend this series as it is very enjoyable to watch with a great heroine but I was a little disappointed by the end which left me hanging.

Skip beat! ...... What can i say ..... in my top 10 anime.
I found a really refreshing anime with a good story and somehow original, but also i wonder why a common story hooked me instantly and now i know it's the character development and also the personalities they have that complements the story so well, that's why i finished loving kyoko's temper and the different "modes" she can get into but that helps somehow in her personal and professional growth.
I wasn't going to watch it at all because synopsis was a bit lame when i read it, but i was killing some time andstarted watching it, and since the 2nd episode i was caught in the story and as it advances u really don't want this anime to finish and the time flies away episode by episode.


This anime made me start reading the manga, since the anime ending was a bit open i did want to see how the story continued so now i'm hooked up with the manga.


I loved the first ED and the second OP they are great!!

I don't like long-winded reviews that are impossible to read because they go on forever, so I'm going to try and make this short and sweet.
At first, Skip Beat seems like an anime with a stupid storyline and shallow, single faced characters. But that impression is quickly proven wrong. It's witty, it's fun, and it's totally engaging. I watched this anime in two days. It was that good. Basically, the main character, Kyoko, gets dumped by her best friend who's a celebrity. Kyoko vows to get revenge by becoming even more famous than her friend. I love this anime because the humor was so great.It made me laugh out loud countless times. The characters are easy to love, and easy to hate. You'll find yourself getting mad with Kyoko, embarrassed with Kyoko, and routing for her every step of the way!\n\n
And guess what? There's romance, too! (but I wasn't the one who told you). Skip Beat! is a great anime, and everybody should get to enjoy it!

I really liked this animé and enjoyed every episode.
The little splashes of romance made it even more interesting!
Some particular scene's are so intense when its just about the main character getting ready to act a part.Also the reason why she changed and wants to get revenge is really fun cause I think allot of people went through thesame thing: getting used by boys they really like(or girls)
I think all of us sometimes fantasize about getting even (or just revenge) with people that used us.
So to see an anime where the main character accomplishes just that is really amusing.
The ending however SUCKS BALLZ! 
I was reallyexpecting something else.\n
It ended so sudden that when the last episode is done,you just stare at your screen with a huge question mark above your head haha\n

Undeniably shoujo, with a good balance of drama and slapstick. Well I must admit there is a LOT of slapstick going on. However, how the plot was shown had an amazingly constant and timely pace to it. In addition to that, the concept is not overly interesting as it is (when you read the synopsis), but how it is portrayed made it so. I will probably watch the next installment of this series and probably read the manga if I have time. This one was worth the time.

For starters: Skip Beat is really good and should be enjoyed by all! I really don't have to explain the plot, mainly because I couldn't get any deeper, the plot is how the summary explains. Anyways, the characters in here (Mainly Kyoko) have impeccable design and are always a riot to watch. Their interior monologues are hilarious and the animation adds extra humor onto the plot. However the romance in here is very questionable, but I can not say much on account that the series is only on season one. BUT I can say that the romance displayed is very very weird.
Overall 8/10 For now,let's wait for the second season, or at least the end, THEN I can give a real review. Let's hope there isn't only one season, oh please NO! I can't take inconclusive series! Argh ^(>o

I deeply enjoyed this anime, I was so sucked in by the story that I didn't want to stop watching it for very long. I finished it a total of two days, though that might be too much. But sadly, now that I've finished it, I really want to see a second season of it, which is sadly not been annouced of yet. I am told that I should read the manga, but that's where the problem lies, how can I swtich from the anime to the manga. 
I might have missed some stuff in the manga that wasn't in the anime and there mightbe stuff in the anime that might not be the in manga. I have to start over the story for me to understand the story again but from a written propective. The transition is not always the easiest. 


But that aside, I will continue on with my review. 


Everything gets 10 out of 10 for these reasons.


Story - Because it was so original, yes, I did see some stuff that seemed like the usual but the way the put much of the stuff together is what made it so out there. The fact that Kyoko joined the acting biz to get revenge on her 'star' boyfriend is something that isn't usually seen in animes such as this. And the backstory of it all really catches and sucks you in. I always wanted to learn more about it and therefore I couldn't stop watching till the very end.


Art - Even though it was one of the more plain and gentle styles, the eys and expressions are what take the art to a new level. The enviroment and the characters are just so well expressed that you can enjoy watching the stunning work of the artists involved in the creation of the anime. They also fit well with the theme of the anime and the personalities of the characters. You can see that much though was put into the artwork.


Sound - At time I never had the best quaity of sound but that is not the anime's fault, mainly the fault of the players I was using. But the voices all went well with each other and suited their characters. There were times when I feel that some voices were off, like a certain director but after some time, I found that he was perfect for the personality of such a character. The effort of the actors move me and at times I felt that I was on the verge of tears. Seeing an anime character cry can move someone, but it's the voice that moves me to tears. So, outstanding on sound.


Character - At first, the characters seem a little bland and at time, rediculous. But as the show progress, you could really see the character development with EVERY character, even the minor ones. Personalities change and grow as I got furthur in the anime, I felt like I really connected to the anime, which is a hard feat on its own. I felt like I understood the feelings protrayed and that I could think of what would need to happen to make that situation better, and that is usually what happens. But what makes me moved by the characters is that you want to cheer on the characters that you favor, like the point where Kyoko goes on set with Shou, the fact that she was able to overcome her difficulties makes you believe in her even more. 


Enjoyment - I was caught up in the story from start to finish, yes, there were times when I put the anime down but that never lasted more than 10 to 30 minutes, I just couldn't stay away from the story. The only down point I saw in the enjoyment part was the fact that it sometimes felt like it was taking too long to get to a point but then again, there were reasons why and it was understand why it took so long. And again, the ending is rather disappointing because there is nothing to follow up on with it. But that just means I will either have to read the manga, which will give even more detail to the story or just wait patiently for the next installment. So, it leaves you wanting more, that's for sure. 


And so, overall, an outstanding 10 to this anime. I just hope they don't make we wait too long for the next installment.

I admit I put this anime off for a very long time because I thought it would be annoying and overrated. However, the moment I started watching I found myself regretting for having put this aside for so long! Now that I have finished watching it I can definitely say this story is one of those to not miss out on.
STORY: It's kind of simple, yet so much more deep. I love how the story manages to pull you in from the beginning (after a couple of episodes or so at max) and never lets you go. It has a lot of events that keepon going which will keep you interested. The best aspect of it was how it was not predictable. You can guess a few things but you will absolutely have no idea how those things will take place. 


ART: I liked the art. I think Ren, Sho and Kyoko were all well animated. They had distinct features and I can never confuse them with other shoujo anime characters. The side characters looked good as well. There were moments where I loved simple stuff like their outfits. So I would say they did a good job with the art.


SOUND: The voice actors were great (especially Kyouko). Plus I love all the songs played in this anime. The background was nothing noteworthy but I liked it enough.


CHARACTER: I must say the characters are amazing! Seriously! Kyouko seems lame and Ren seems predictable in the beginning but they completely prove you wrong as the story progresses. If you like slow romance and good character development- this is the story for you. As far as characters go, I don't think there can be more perfect examples.


ENJOYMENT: The humor is great, the drama is gripping and the romantic moments are sweet. For me it left no room to get bored. So it's a very enjoyable anime. :)


OVERALL: 10/10.


I don't know whether I'll ever find a shoujo anime that would beat SKIP BEAT. I will remember it for a long, long time. :)

Story : It is about this plain girl who dedicated her life to one guy.  She finds out he was using her, so she wants revenge in showbiz, since he's an idol.  
Art : It isn't too great.  I don't really like the design of the guys.  I really like the MC's facial expressions.  When she changes her hairstyles and stuff, it's nice because it seems so fresh.
Sound : The OP and ED were eh.  Nothing special.  
Character : Great character development.  One of the best I've seen ever in an anime.  The main girl reallydevelops.  You can see how changed she becomes when she finds out the guy was using her.  Also, one she enters the business, she becomes more mature.  She is one of my favorite characters ever.  I thought she would be annoying, initially, but it's the opposite.  Shotaro is the guy that used her.  I know I should hate him, but I really liked him.  I ship them.  I didn't like the other guy, Ren.  He was so boring and got mad at Kyoko for stupid stuff.  He was just really bland.\n\n
Enjoyment : Loved the beginning and middle of the series.  It was so great to find another great anime.  The ending got boring, cliché, and it was unsatisfying.  It's worth watching for the beginning, though.\n\n
Overall : It really surprised me.  It doesn't seem good from the summary and art, but give it a try.  I bet you'll like it.

This anime is THE SHIT™. 10/10.
Initially, I wasn't going to watch it because the art looked like cancer, but I'm so glad that I eventually did.
I've heard many people say that 'the art is bad', and that 'there isn't enough romance'. SKIP BEAT IS A SHOUJO ANIME THAT CENTRES AROUND THE DEVELOPMENT AND GROWTH OF THE MAIN CHARACTER, KYOKO MOGAMI.
What people don't seem to understand is that, despite being a shoujo, the anime isn't just about Kyoko's relationship with Ren, or any other male lead. It's purely about Kyoko's growth as an actress and as a person, and her realising that revenge may not bethe only thing she wants in life.\n
Another critique that I've often heard is that 'the anime is too short', or that 'it doesn't end properly'.\n
This is purely because of the manga being very long and still ongoing. The manga had begun in 2002, and is still continuing today. The series is yet to have an actual ending, so this would have been virtually impossible to achieve in 25 episodes of the anime.\n
Having said that, I highly recommend Skip Beat's manga (I prefer it to the anime) to those who disliked the anime's abrupt ending.\n
Bye (go watch Skip Beat) 😎😎😎

Skip Beat! had everything I could hope for in a good anime - a compelling story, amazingly likable characters, and great humor. 
I found myself thoroughly engaged in the Kyoko's story. A few minutes in and I was already invested. 
I had to stop watching so I could vent about Shotaro's betrayal, even though I knew about it before hand. And I still do, as I read the manga. Not many anime can do that to you... make you feel for the characters' situation to that extent. 
This, in my opinion, deserves all the praise it gets. That's why I scored it so high. It'slike a breath of fresh air among the crowds of newer, clichéd shows that come out all the time. A must see for any anime fan. \n\n
Fair warning, though: the anime does not have an ending. It was one of those shows that were cancelled before the manga finished. So the anime only goes up to volume 11 (chapter 66) of the manga, leaving many plot points unresolved. However, the manga continues well past that.

YAY FOR SKIP BEAT!! I watched this a while ago, but I decided, Heck this definitely deserves a review. I have rewatched and rewatched this anime on Crunchyroll. I absolutely adore it. 
Story 10/10
Main girl gets gipped by her childhood love, sets out for revenge by challenging him in the entertainment industry. 
AMAZING. FANTASTIC. DOWNRIGHT PERFECT.
Art 9/10
Comfortable to look at. First anime I've seen with this type of style in the eyes, and yes, I did actually like them. I'll admit that sometimes the physical builds of the characters bothered me a little, but it wasn't anything major and unacceptable.
Sound 9/10 
Nice opening/ending themes.Music perfectly showcased what was going on. Great, but not enough of a standout to me to deserve a 10. 


Character 10/10


I LOVE THE CHARACTERS SO MUCH IT'S NOT EVEN FUNNY. Do I need to say more? Probably not, but I will anyway.


Mogami (Main) LOVE HER. Strong, independent, and a little naïve. Determined, headstrong, and kind. 


Ren LOVE HIM. I can't really put my finger on a particular trait, but I love the way he interacts with other characters.


Shotaro/Sho/Enemy of Mogami Arrogant, selfish, has trouble expressing his feelings to others.


Enjoyment 10/10


Considering how many times I've watched this, I think it actually deserves an 11, but hey that's not allowed.


Overall 10/10


As anyone will tell you, downright awesome.

Definitely a must watch comedy at this moment. the same company that made special a which is quite promising, if not better. The inner demon parts of individuals just spice the things up dramatically.

Anyone who is into the shoujo and slice of life genre will probably enjoy this anime. The art and music are so-so, and the plot is cliche and pretty predictable, but its the character growth and interactions -- the story of how the main character and those around her reach their goals that makes the a fun anime to watch. 
The heroine is a likable female character -- strong, independent, and friendly to those around her and her contempt for her friend who dumped her is realistic and relatable to anyone who has had someone betray their trust. Even though her revenge against the friendwho "dumped" her was an initial motivation for her to pursue her career, I liked that this man wasn't too much of a focus for her character's growth and that she was able to find other, better things that could keep her going.\n\n
I'd say the worse part about this anime is the fact the the ending left me hanging and wished that there was more. Oh well, time to read the manga!

I watched this entire series in one shot. I really wish I could give it a higher score, I really do, and up until the last episode, it easily had an 8... however, the lack of any real conclusion, and dropping of certain story elements was just too disappointing.
There is no romantic conclusion, the point card system of the Love Me department just sort of disappears, she doesn't even get to make a real debut (the seeming point). There is a half conclusion with her ex-boyfriend Sho, but I would have liked to see more, seeing as they kept going back to him after hisarc should have concluded.\n\n
It really is a pity, since there was a good range of characters and character development, and the animation wasn't shabby in the slightest. It was just really annoying to watch the first 18 episodes have very solid plot directions, and the last 7 waver about as if they didn't know what plot line to go with. Episode 25 felt like a 22 minute spot for a season two, not a finale. :(

Story: It starts out like a revenge story, but becomes more off Kyoko's development story about how she becomes from nobody to somebody in the acting biz with some romance mixed in. But be careful the romance part of this show only shows itself after episode 20 or so with some. Most of the time until then it kinda is more like a comedy story about Kyoko and her career.
Art: It was better then I expected for a Shoujo anime. Almost all of the time pretty, shiny man didn't get into the screen to obscure my view. Also characters were drawn very good, but Inoticed about 3 times for few seconds that some character body parts seemed out of proportion. Background art was very good too.


Sound: First OP was very good,but not catchy and I wouldn't want to listen to it normally, but it did fit well with the feel of the Skip Beat. Second OP wasn't bad either but it was nothing special.


Character: This is the strong point of this anime. Kyoko, Fuwa, Ren are all great characters. Specially Kyoko, she was very funny and I liked how she developed her acting and personality through out the series. Only thing I didn't like was that Kyoko all the time even to the end was naive. I kinda expected her to become more tougher and hardened, because she was betrayed by Fuwa.


Enjoyment: I enjoyed Skip beat even though I'm not a shoujo anime fan, but I liked this anime mostly because of the comedy and the characters and how it all was put together.


Overall: Don't be afraid to watch this anime just because it is Shoujo. It is hilarious, entertaining and heartwarming. It may be a little naive and a bit stupid some times, but all people are a bit naive and stupid. Skip Beat isn't a perfect anime that i would recommend to all. But still take a look at this anime if you like comedy or you have nothing else good to watch .

This anime was very outstanding because of it's main protagonist Kyouko. I feel like she wraps up the story quite nicely and it's really enjoyable to have a protagonist who doesn't cry when she falls but instead gets right back up. 
Also, this anime is very realistic in the sense that Kyouko doesn't always win and that she has to work hard to have a career in showbiz. Despite the constant lingering of romance, it only reaches it's climax at the end so I suggest you should watch the show for comedy rather than romance.

These are of those rare gems that I'm very happy to read tenfold. Before you just pass by this review without a second glance-- this is coming from someone who left shoujo because I was dissatisfied by the lack of character development and cringing by stereotypical main pairs. 
You probably already know the standard stuff, so I'll go on with what was personally important to me: the focus on her ability as an actor rather than the focus on romance. 
Don't get me wrong, I love romance, however, they were able to steer clear from the sterotypical shoujo bull. Instead of the idea love, they'remore focused on her Kyoko's development, even Ren was focused by her talent. 


It was only then that senpai/kouhai relationship used this factor to bloom romance. 


Sadly, this anime is barely a quarter of the manga. Literally. If you were to read the manga you'd be already in quarter in-- and girl. The best stuff happens in the manga. 


Overal, I'd give the anime an 8. My manga review is entirely different.

A shōjo like no other (and it feels great!)
Get ready to laugh over and over again!
Wouldn't Skip Beat be one of the most hilarious mangas that exists? Honestly, I think so.
First the synopsis. The main character - Kyōko Mogami - moved to Tokyo to follow her childhood friend - Shō Fuwa - (whom she is in love with). Having become a well-known singer in Japan, he ended up manipulating Kyōko, throwing her away from his life like she was nothing to begin with. Put yourself in her shoes? What would you do? I would probably cry. Well Kyōko has decided otherwise and she intends totake revenge. She decides to become an actress and integrate the competing company of Shō which produces stars such as actors and singers. Then she will meet the other main character - Ren Tsuruga – a handsome talented man recognized as one or even the best actor in Japan. He will become his mentor and will start falling in love with Kyōko.


A love triangle like no other

Let's agree, I hate love triangles in shojos, too cliché for my taste. The main character is generally in love with the brown hair guy, the brown is also in love with her but cannot admit his feelings. Then the sad heroine will find some comfort in the arms of a very kind blond, respectful and always present. Their story develops and then plot twist! The brown finally wakes up after months and decides to win back her love and the worst is that he succeeds. And the blond guy (way too nice) lets his sweetheart join his true love... MY GOD STOP!


Skip Beat offers a completely different approach:

1°) The heroine has built a real relationship with the two men. As a result, we appreciate these two relationships.

2°) The three characters are charismatic, funny, ambitious and slightly naive which gives them an endearing side. It also allows the story to go further.


More than 250 chapters...

Skip Beat has been published monthly since 2002. The series is still in progress with over 250 chapters/42 volumes (83 chapters/18 volumes for Ouran High School Host Club, 85 chapters/18 volumes for Kaichou Wa Maid-sama!).


Why is the story still not finished?

If we constantly wonder how the love story will evolve, we do not forget that the main character is Kyōko, and which heroine: beautiful, funny, intelligent, ambitious. She is not just reduced to a girl who seeks love since Kyōko, betrayed by Shō, refuses to fall in love again. She has a real goal: to become the greatest actress in Japan. The story invites us to follow her dream.


In summary

I read a lot of shōjos and for now Skip Beat is my favorite one. I have read it over and over again with the same enthusiasm. I therefore advise it to all those who are revolted by weak main characters who take no initiative. Kyōko Mogami is an example for all the heroines of shōjo.

A nearly perfect shoujo anime, with one small fault, in my eyes.
Now, it's worth noting I am obviously not the target audience for Skip Beat, so that might be something to note. I have seen my fair share of shoujo anime, and liked most of them actually,  but I'm still probably writing from a different perspective than most viewers of this show.
So what is my one fault I had with this particular anime? 
I guess, to put it simply, the "wish fulfillment" (aka fan-service) element of the story, specifically in the romantic department. This is not inherently a negative, but it is fairly egregiousin this case, at least IMO. I'll explain.


In Skip Beat, the main character Kyouko, like in most shoujo anime, is a teenage girl. After being tossed aside by her narcissistic, a-hole pop idol boyfriend, Shoutaro, she has decided her ultimate revenge will be to show him up in his world, the world of show business. 


She quickly ends up working for the talent agency of Shoutaro's hated rival, the slightly more kind-hearted, and "serious" acto,  Ren. We actually get a brief introduction to him in the beginning of the show when, much to the chagrin of Shoutaro, he appears on TV and places 1st in a poll for most attractive men in Japan, while Shoutaro is all the way down at 7.


Without spoiling anything, you can probably see what is coming. The most fan-servicey psuedo-love triangle (it's debatable whether one should include Shoutaro, but based on some of his obvious jealously later in the series, I thought it was appropriate) I've seen in an anime. I mean, two hugely popular celebrities, and apparently 2 of the 7 best looking guys in the entire country, are the two MC's love interests? Really?


It sort of reminded me of Harem in that respect (although obviously this is not a Harem, as there is at most 2 suitors), in that Kyouko, as most harem MCs do, served as the self-insert character that found herself in a very fortuitous romantic scenario. And this is after having her heart broken by an ex who becomes increasingly flustered seeing her doing so well, which just adds to the fantasy element. And, much like Harem anime, this made it a little difficult to take the romantic element too seriously.


Luckily though, the anime excelled at everything else. Kyouko is a fantastic lead. She's funny, determined, a little quirky, and just so easy to root for. Not only that, but I feel there was legitimate growth of her character throughout the series, largely because of her willingness to take a critical look at her actions and see where she is erring. Overall, one of the better leads in any romance anime I've seen.


As for the other characters, aspiring actress and "frenemy" Moko, as well as a very eccentric president of the talent agency were standouts. As I mentioned before, I wasn't a huge fan of either of the almost fanservice-y love interests. 


But maybe where Skip Beat shines the brightest is in its comedy. A lot of this takes place within Kyouko's vivid imagination, and there's also a decent amount of chibi scenes, which work surprisingly well. Marina Inoue, the MC's VA, absolutely nails it and basically steals the show. I can legitimately say it is one of the 5 funniest anime I've seen.


As far as the art and music, I can't really say it was great or terrible, it was merely good.


So, overall, I give Skip Beat an 8. It's just slightly disappointing that it could've been truly GREAT if it wasn't for some pandering towards the target audience.

The anime has to be picked up again and continue from where it's left off.

The only problem is the art. It's...not very clear. That's why I like the anime and can't read the manga, because the anime makes it clear and prettier.

I was interested into this anime since I first heard the premise.
Story: Despite her original intention for trying to become a star, Kyoko turns out to be a strong and persistent character that ends up taking her future into her own hands. She takes her initial drama and pain and transforms it into the energy she needs to boost herself up the stardom ladder. 
Characters: The vast array of characters is what makes this series truly enjoyable. The story focuses a lot on character development, and not just for our main heroine. Kyoko is a fresh character - and it is a bit sad to say this in2017 since the anime was released in 2008. 


Art: Now the art was something I had trouble with at the beginning... I am just not used to this art and it took me a bunch of episodes to learn to get over it and not look at their weird proportions. But I truly enjoyed the art during the comedic scenes. The colors are bright and the details are clean, but nothing special.


Sound: Most of the time I ignore the background music and music in general when it comes to anime. Unless the sound is spectacular, it usually goes unnoticed, which is a good thing in my humble opinion.


Enjoyment: Tremendous! I loved how it managed to blend the tragic story moments with the comedy scenes. It didn't disrupt the story flow. Plus I loved the art style from the funny bits. To have Skip Beat! as my first finished series since returning to this hobby is a great way to start!


Overall: I recommend it! Great character development and story. One small flaw, and it is probably due to the manga being incomplete at the time of the anime - the ending is kinda open, although positive - and there are a lot of plots that need to be further explored. So I might need to read the manga now.

This anime....I have to take a mental pause before I go into it about this anime.
Why do I love this character?
First of all, she doesn't cry and takes out some sort of hammer and knocks the crap out of those who try to get in her way...
She wants friends, she wants to be loved by her friends she doesnt want to fall in love she truly enjoys her works and loves that her good work crushes those who try to mess with her....
essentially Kyoko is a mental person, but I love that!
Then we have Ren! And unfortunately I can't give too much info on hischaracter without going into  spoilers since essentially the anime covers Kyoko and her rise to stardom, again this is one of those anime where it can be looked at as an advertisement to the manga and while I would love to see a second season I would be very upset if they didnt follow the manga closely(like they did with the first) or made it better..which they can't....I like to laugh, I like to cry, I like to laugh while crying, this thing gets a 10.

Enjoyment- 10/10, it had me constantly watching until I finished the anime.
Story-  9/10 Interesting, entertaining and gets better with development. The only thing I would that is kind of a negative at times wad that her drive to be an amazing actress irritated me but that changes through out the anime.
Characters- 9/10
 Kyoko Mogami: I really like Kyoko as a character, she is very different from the usual heroine. She is terrifying, strong, extremely kind, and adorable. Her personality is so funny whether or not she is attacking someone with her aura or doting on Kanae. As she develops we come to understand herheart condition and how deeply she was affected by Sho. I love Kyoko and feel an attachment to her character.\n
Tsugara Ren: At first I wasn't sure how I felt about him but as the anime goes on I fall in love with him as well. He does under go development in the anime concerning how he had never really loved anyone and how that affects his career and as he comes to understand his feelings. Though the anime only being 25 episodes he left alot of unanswered questions that can only be found in the manga (which I read after the show but is still ongoing).\n
Fuwa Sho: I will say this straight out, I do not like him. Anime or Manga I don't like him. Though that is my opinion because I love Kyoko, he does under go development further in the anime and you see his feelings change (but only a little). He develops more in the manga by a little, but i still don't like him. One thing I will say is I looked forward to his appearances in the anime because of Mamoru Miyano's performance which was beautiful as always. I really like his song Prisoner as well, I still listen to that :)\n
There are other characters given development but I'm not going to really talk about them because they are supporting and it would take too long. But I did like Kanae, Maria, the president and Yashiro. I really like how Yashiro shipped Ren and Kyoko :D\n
Animation- 8/10 Solid and is the embodiment of the Manga which is from the early 2000s. It was pretty normal and solid but nice to look at, I like the chibi appearances which are in the Manga also.\n
Sound- 7/10 Average, the openings and ending are forgettable and I always skipped. The only memorable performance was by Mamoru Miyano and that was Prisoner which is amazing by its self and I still listen to it.\n
Problems- The only problem I had with the way things went is that they stopped after 25 episodes when the Manga is still going on and already has over 200 chapters. The manga has been going on for 12 years. Sadly they left it as a "go read the manga" anime and that is disappointing but I did go read the manga and I recommend you do too! I just wish it wasn't uncompleted after 12 years. Which also means there wasn't that much romance in the anime which goes back to the "go read the manga" issue but it is what it is.\n
Overall- 10/10 This anime was so entertaining and really is a favorite, I give it a 5 our of 5 saying I wish it wasn't over!

What would you do if you got thrown away like a tissue paper by the guy you've always liked? You'd sulk over it, get depressed and feel hurt but our protagonist... isn't quite the normal one.
Story: 9 - Kyouko Mogami had always been chasing after her childhood friend and crush Shoutaro as she even willingly came with him to Tokyo so that he can fulfill his dream of becoming an idol. One day when Kyouko overhears Shou's opinion of her as a boring housekeeper and will leave her soon, the innocent and sweet Kyouko goes berserk as she vows to get her revenge by defeatinghim in the entertainment industry. This story isn't quite original but the the way it was presented and how it actually turns out is what makes me love this anime.


Art: 8 - The art is kind of old but that's expected from a 2006's anime. I think the art overall was quite good as well as the right movements used during the acting scenes.


Sound: 8 - ( I almost forgot this anime had a opening and ending...). Some of the soundtrach was...forgettable. But some songs and OST's used during the anime were good. The seiyuus had done a great job too.


Character: 9 - I gave one extra point for Kyouko because no matter how many times I see her I just can't get enoughh as she is so hilarious and quirky yet dense. But generally all of the characters were good as they fulfilled their roles perfectly.


Enjoyment: 10 - This is an extremely enjoyable anime and is suited for anyone.


People who liked: Glass no Kamen,Kodomo No Omocha,Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge,Kaleido Star,Full Moon Wo Sagashite and Paradise Kiss will enjoy this series due to some similar aspects.


Overall: 9 - This is overall a great anime that can be enjoyed by anyone.

Hell hath no fury like a schoolgirl halfway to housewifedom scorned.
Submissive, homey together-since-childhood girlfriend of an aspiring pop star, who works two jobs to pay his rent and spends her free time packing him exquisite lunches and stroking his ego, accidentally overhears him speak of just using borind old her - for her "convenience"... AND SNAPS.
And oh boy, does she snap BIG TIME. And decides to destroy her ex - in his field, on his terms... Tokyo's showbiz doesn't know it yet, but it's just gained its newest, most lovable (and successful) schizo yet. Her niches: CUTENESS + HATRED.  
Packing enough negative energy tostare down Darth Vader and make grown men cry, bullish stubbornness and banzai charge mentality enough for two Edward Elrics, the momentum of a freight train, a few voodoo dolls, human-shaped candles, and enough kindness (!) and heart to touch and defrost the coldest of Tokyo showbiz's hearts, she is about to unwittingly embark on a wonderful journey of self-discovery and self-improvement. Doing lots of good and scaring the bejesus out of a bunch of people along the way.\n\n
It's not the destination that matters - it's all about the road... Probably. Wouldn't know. This otherwise phenomenal anime's conclusion constitutes the last 2 mins of an otherwise regular episode. Not a single arc is wrapped up ;_((( The conclusion is basically "ooh wonder what tomorrow will bring - but it'll probably be BEAUTIFUL". Meh. \n\n
DEFINITELY WATCH, though. Just treat it like a slice of life or something - finality will NOT be achieved, relationships will not culminate, seemingly recurring characters will not recurr, etc. etc.

Skip Beat!
I am conflicted here. Nearly every episode ended with a cliff hanger that made me want to watch the next, and even after the anime was finished I wanted to watch more. I believe the reason for this is that there is a such a strong purpose to the story line and how the actors work their way through it.
Every day is filled with a passion for work, laughter, and a serious hatred towards the guy who broke the main character's heart. The main character's emotions are so extraordinarily vibrant that she can't help but act them out in front of people. She reallygoes the extra mile, and some people become confused when she does this because she totally is not paying attention to her surroundings.  Not in a clumsy kind of way, of course, though it's really quite the spectacle. 


What it comes down to in this anime is that the main character suffered an extreme heart break, and is willing to do what ever it takes to get revenge. In doing so, she becomes someone who she never imagined, meets many new people, and work extremely hard towards her goal. Such enthusiasm.


I've been careful not to give away much of anything towards the story line, as it all kind of came as a surprise to me, and I think you would appreciate it if the story unfolded towards you as well.


Now comes the ratings:

Story - 10 - There was one main objective here. The very same objective was consistently fueled with a renew fire, and it's kind of cool how this is dealt with near the end of the anime.

Graphics - 10 - The developers really went over and above in expressing the many different emotions and scenes in this anime. The use of flashbacks, dynamic view angles, alternative character displays, screen manipulating events, and many more.

Sound - 9 - The background themes really set the mood, while the individual action sound, such as a chicken 'PIKAAAA'ing, were rather quite funny.

Character Personas - 10 - Every character had their strengths and flaws portrayed through this anime. I could sense a manner of honesty and outrageous activity between characters interactions, and I say that because different characters perceive each other differently. A spoiled rich girl believes that she is honestly more important than everyone else, so why does everyone get mad at her?.. These kinds of events occur between personas.

Voice Acting - 10 - WOW. The main character really had me at awe at times. She had a tendency to become a magician with her own voice at times. By the way, this is the Japanese actor that I am speaking of, Marina Inoue.


Overall - 10 - I honestly wanted to give this anime a lower score because the pace can be slow, however I was never once bored with this show. In fact, some days I thought I had watched too many episodes. I recommend this anime as a humorous romance, and the show felt like an 8, but somehow I am giving it a 10.

Ahh!!! A story about sweet revenge. Indeed, revenge is best serve cold but in this case with lots and lots of laughter. While your laughing your hearts out, you will experience how great the feeling it is to see the main character serve her revenge.
There’s a long review coming!
ABOUT THE STORY
There’s nothing more fun and astonishing when getting revenge to the man who broke your heart. I can still feel how great the feeling is. The story didn’t have a magnificent-like story that needed an Oscar Award but the story of this series was undeniably captivating. Even though the romantic part was not well-explored likethe usual scenes in your typical love stories where the two main characters after realizing that they have feelings for each other started going out or ended up getting married but in this series you will still experience the wonderful feeling of falling in love. I also love how the main character struggled to achieve her goals and realized that though her primary goal was to have revenge, more than anything else she realized what she truly wants to do for herself. Not to satisfy her pride or anything but for her to know herself more. To know her boundaries and if she can do more after she realized her limits. But then again, my favorite part was when she showed that asshole what she can do without him in her life. That she can surpass him with her own perseverance and faith with herself.  Every episode was worth watching that I had to save it. I been an Anime lover for so many years and I always save up all the series that I treasure so that I can watch them again but I didn’t save every each episode of those series but Skip Beat! made me save every episode from first to last which is ver rare for me, that shows how great the series is. 


ABOUT THE CHARACTERS

Every character in the series lives up to their roles. Even the very much hated reason for Kyoko’s craziness was really annoying. Even you would want to see Kyoko crush the guts of that useless guy. Love the very mysterious and cool guy Ren. If you already read the manga, you’ll be fascinated by the mysterious dark past of Ren which is mostly contributes his will not to fall in love because he thinks he doesn’t have the rights to be happy. That romantic feeling you will have when the only person who can get him out of the darkness is none other than Kyouko. Let’s not forget that flamboyant President Takarada who knows everything and shows up at the right time and says the right words at the right time. He’s like a fairy godmother well in his case fairy godfather who would always support both main characters behind the scene. He always plots something as so the two can be together, overcome their issues and realize their feelings for each other. I really love his character so much. 


ABOUT KYOKO AND REN

But the best character, well of course, Kyoko’s character. Nowadays, women have more balls. I really love it when after she found out what Sho really felt for her, instead of crying like your typical frail goody-good-shoes heroine, Kyoko fought back right away. She struggled to achieve her goal and never got depress when she was dumped. Instead, she used those depressing feelings of being used so she can show him what he lost. When she has finally got the chance to show him what she’s made off, she did not only kick his sorry ass but also made him realize those feelings which he thought he didn’t have for her. And boy when she shows-off her acting skills it was so exciting. She’s also one hilarious girl. Every time she goes to her own world, you’ll laugh till you drop. Despite having an evil aura, she can be so damn hilarious which makes her more amazing. Another one that I really love about her was that despite having those depressing feelings she still managed to have a great outlook in life and even changed the people around her particularly the very calm and cool Ren. When you combine a not so honest with his true feelings type of guy and one hell of dense type girl, you ended up being irritated. For instance, when Ren was talking about the girl he might have feelings with, Kyoko didn’t even realize that she was the one Ren was describing. Ren, who didn’t know how to show his happiness whenever Kyoko was involved and kept denying his feelings for her. After I finished watching it, I genuinely wish that Kyoko would finally let go of his hatred for Sho and forget about him so she can focus more on her career and her growing feelings for Ren. Though the only thing that I hate about her is that she can be so dense at times, this is mostly in the manga.  Not even realizing that some people are using her, taking advantage of her, letting Sho kiss her, and most importantly, not even realizing that Ren is in love with her. Well that goes for both of them not realizing that the other is already in love with the other. But then again, it is still amazing how both of them influences each other‘s life for the better.


ABOUT THE ANIMATION

Animation is great. Some characters are really gorgeous looking and a lot of important scenes are made magnificently.


All in all, I enjoyed it a lot. Another great treasure for my collection. This series made me laugh, cry, fall in love and most importantly amazed. It would be a sin not to remember this series even after so many years. I am dying to see that next season!

Skip Beat! is about showbiz, but our heroine, Kyoko, is climbing up the showbiz ladder for revenge. Yes, revenge!
Kyoko has been supporting her childhood friend, Shotaro, wholeheartedly all this while, sacrificing herself just for her one and only Sho. Sho is pursuing a career in music and is currently ranked 7th most popular male celebrity of Japan. However, everything changes when Kyoko overheard a conversation between Sho and his manager, where Sho insults Kyoko, saying that he only keeps her for her usefulness in housekeeping matters. Further fueled by Sho flirting with the manager, Kyoko vows vengeance, so Sho teasingly challenges her to overtake him inshowbiz.


And that’s exactly what Kyoko sought out to do. She makes new friends (and maybe even one that is more than a friend) throughout her new career and on the way, slowly pushes away the vengeful feelings that overwhelmed her at the beginning. Will she ever learn to love again


This is a shojo that incorporates showbiz as well as a whole load of comedy. Kyoko isn’t your weak-willed heroine, she’s fiery and has her eyes set on revenge. Immediately after vowing vengeance, Kyoko went for a makeover and joins Sho’s rival talent agency, hoping to crush Sho at his own game.

Story 
 9/10
I fount the story to be quite different from the usual Shoujo manga style. It was honest and had a nice feel to it.
Because of this difference I think I enjoyed it all the more. I have the say that the acting in this anime is the best I've seen yet. They make a big deal of the littlest details which makes you enjoy it all the more.
Animation 
 8/10
The animation isn't all that great- just the usual kinda. But they were able to show case the different expression beautifully. Especially the one that involved acting scenes. 
It was light and humorous henceit suited the anime.\n\n
Sound \n
 7/10\n\n
It's actually addictive. Certain phrases and words are used so many times that they pop up in your mind when you least expect it.\n\n
Characters \n
 9/10\n\n
Superb and unique cast of characters with their own type of persona. Whether it's the non-believer of love Kyoko or the angel like smile Tsuruga Ren gives when he is angry. \n
You fall in love with them and their uniqueness.\n\n
Overall \n
 9.5/10\n\n
This is a must-watch anime. \n
It's hilarious, sad, breath-taking and absolutely wonderful. \n
NOT YOUR TYPICAL SHOUJO MANGA! \n
The main character Kyoko is different and very like-able. \n
Her story is different, as well as her emotions. \n
A plot to become famous to exert revenge on the boy she loved after she finds out that he was just using her as a stepping stone. \n
Some scenes were so funny that you continue to laugh long after you have finished watching it. \n
I absolutely love this anime. \n
The only downside to it, is the ending. \n
It ended too soon!! Which forces you to read the manga. \n
I hope they make a season 2 of this great anime.\n

Absolutely hilarious anime concerning a teenage girl’s unlikely entry into show business. Her attitude is awful, her reasons are terrible, but little by little, she begins to find meaning in her pursuit. It’s a great show, but I appreciate it more because of the trail of inquiry it put me on. Basically, anyone and everyone can agree that in mainstream western entertainment, there’s a dearth of female-centered narratives (mothers, girlfriends of main characters, sex objects seem to be the norm). Anime/manga seems more open to the idea of female-centered narratives in general; this includes generic shoujo romance to something more radical and/or atypical like TheTwelve Kingdoms. The point is this: it’s rare to find modern narrative features/TV works that focus so largely on presenting the mindset/interior states of its female characters, and I’m finding more of this in anime/manga than anywhere else. Skip Beat! is a perfect example of this: a total genre pleasure (comedy) that never skimps on its character development, treats its main subject with dignity and respect (even when she’s acting like an idiot) and sports a fully-realized female creation that remains fascinating and entertaining. This is rare.\n\n
copied/pasted from my blog: www.thenextthingblog.wordpress.com

I have the pleasure now of reviewing one of the best anime I have ever seen. I believe I initially did not give Skip Beat a fair shot because of its ending but after watching it again I remembered how good it really was. I'm assuming you already know what Skip Beat is about so I'll get right into it.
Story: 9.5/10
Such a fun and fascinating story with great plot progression. Revenge and show business are things that are always interesting to watch. Mix in beautiful men, beautiful (but crazy) women and inner demons and you have a winning recipe for a shoujo manga. 
The onlything keeping me from giving the story a 10 is the ending. The ending is so abrupt, it leaves so many ends untied and so many possibilities left to explore that I cannot say I was at all satisfied. The series was so good that the ending left a bitter taste. But the series is THAT good that I couldn't score it any lower than a 9.5. 


Character: 10/10

The protagonist, Kyoko Mogami, is one of the best female characters in any anime. She is strong, crazy, fun, loveable and not to mention, SUPER TALENTED. Her acting skills are captivating to watch, making the characters she plays come to life (whether it is intentional or not). Her ex-" boyfriend" Shou is the scum of the earth, but you can't help but like how detestable he is. Ren Tsuraga may be the perfect male lead and love interest to counteract Kyoko's craziness and ability. There is also a great supporting cast of characters. There was decent plot progression but again the ending disrupts that flow. 


Art and Sound: both 8/10

Both suitable for a shoujo anime. The colors and background music were used so well to express emotions. 


Enjoyment: 10/10

Overall: 9/10

Such an enjoyable anime with some of the most memorable scenes in any anime I've watched to date. Episodes 6,7,13 and 14 were so enjoyable that I watched them twice through before moving on to the next episode (and this review is based on a REWATCH...that says a lot). The over-the-top nature of the characters is so funny to watch but the true enjoyment in this anime is seeing the development of Kyoko's natural and unbelievable talent, despite being constantly underestimated. 

If this series had gotten a second season or even a couple more episodes, it would be a definite 10/10 as they just don't wrap things up well at all. 


I would recommend watching this anime despite its ending, as the manga continues the story and is still on-going..... meaning there is so much more of Kyoko to enjoy. 

Similar recommendations to this anime I would say would be Nodame Cantabile and Special A because they all have girls with natural ability who work on their talents and look up to the male lead who is gorgeous, talented and constantly making fun of her. 


To be honest, I cannot adequately express how highly I think of this anime. I would suggest at least watching the first episode. If you are not laughing hysterically or automatically fall in love with Kyoko's craziness and longing for revenge, then this anime definitely isn't for you.

Skip beat is an interesting shojo anime about a young plain girl named kyoko. She lives the simple life of a high school drop out, working at what essentially amounts to a McDonalds and living in a small apartment. The one main drive in her life is her, idol, her beloved Sho, the man of her dreams who carried her from her home to live with him. Sho treats Kyoko like dirt, and Kyoko simply enjoys being within the same room as him... That is until she finds him cheating on her with his manager. Kyoko is furious and confronts Sho, only to be toldthat she was a stepping stone in his career to further gain his own goals. Kyoko then does something different, she doesn't walk away silently, or break into tears. No, she turns into Satan himself, and swears absolute vengeance on the tard Shotaro. 


Thus the adventure begins for Kyoko to become a better starlet than Sho could ever be. Now overall the story while being fairly originial and told very well, is overall pretty simple... a girls struggle to be the best form a very meager start. The art and music are also above average, but for the most part nothing spectacular. What makes this show stand out more than any other show is the main character herself, kyoko. So much effort is put into the series to show off Kyoko's very VERY unstable emotions as she varies from evil to happy to depression all within the blink of an eye. While the change in mood is sudden and unpredictable you can't help but laugh every time Kyoko has a argument with herself, to the disbelief of passers by.


Overall the show is pretty good, and would be worth watching even if Kyoko wasn't the main focus, but it is Kyoko's outstanding character that really sets this show aside from any other anime.

Skip Beat! is the charming and altogether hilarious tale of Kyouko, a young girl who gave up everything for childhood friend Shou, only to learn he was only “using her for convince” once he’s made it to fame. A passionate and energetic girl, Kyouko quickly changes the course of her efforts from serving Shou, to taking revenge on him. Of course, the only way she can do this is to also join show biz, and best him in the process. 
Thus Skip Beat! begins. The story was nothing spectacular, though it was unique enough, however, the characters were what made the anime, especially Kyouko, withher laughable and intimidating “Dark Side” and her thirst for revenge. I would definitely recommend this anime. 


Story: 7

The story doesn’t leave you breathless or shocked; there are no wrenching twists or highly complicated ideas or morals. Despite this, it flowed believably and at a nice pace, with enough catches and emotion to keep you watching and get you hooked. While not perfect, it was strong enough to stand on its own and was well-tempered. It was also very refreshing to watch an anime—especially one of this genre—that presented a character with such a passionate and hilarious motive, a motive that she held onto, even along with story progression and character growth. 


Art: 6

The art was attractive enough and the animation, while far from perfect, was adequately done. My one problem was the way the two male leads were drawn from the front, which rendered them rather horse-faced and jaw-less. However, I eventually got over that, and they look fine in profile and such. The characters also spent a lot of time in Chibi form, however it was done cleanly enough, except for a few times when the characters changed right in front of you.  


Sound: 7

The sound was decent, but it didn’t stand out. The creators did a good job of accenting the different scenes with catchy music, and the voice acting was well-done. There wasn’t much else to it. However, I found the opening and ending songs really annoying…


Character: 9

I really loved that characters and the character development. They were really what made this anime for me. Kyouko is likable, humorous, and soon has you rooting for her. I also really enjoyed her passion and motivation, and was glad that, even as you watch her grow and come to love acting, she still hangs on to her need for revenge. Ren is also well done, because you can see his love for his job, and the reasons for the way he treats Kyouko. The way both of them interact and help each other grow was also very well portrayed. Throughout the story, they also reveal deeper reasons for the characters actions and give them all deeper motivation, which I appreciated and thought was nicely done. My one problem was Shou, as he is portrayed as a heartless enemy till the last few episodes, where the creators begin to show that however shallow he is, he may really care about Kyouko, and maybe there is something more too him. It felt “too little too late” and kind of sloppy. I am desperately hoping they continue the series with a sequel, so hopefully they’ll get cleaned up by then. 


Enjoyment: 10

I would watch it again. And maybe again…and again. I was laughing hysterically almost the whole time, and two episodes in I was dreading the end of the show. As I said, I’ll be waiting for the second season with big expectations. 


Overall: 8

It was funny, unique and lovable. There were a number of faults, but I still think Skip Beat! Is worth the time. I know I, at least, enjoyed myself…

Felt like writing a review of Skip beat.
Now I really hate Shoujo style animes, but in this one it didn't bother me as much since they had lot of chibi moments.
