After reading the synopsis of Skip Beat, I hesitated a bit before give it a try but I ended up loved this anime a lot.  I liked the storyline which sets in the show-biz industry instead of plain boring school life comedy.  
The characters in Skip Beat are pretty well developed.  Each of them have a unique depth of history and how each character changes.  
I wish there will be a second season coming soon because the ending was not satisfy at all.  The ending seems to be a rush and didn't explain what happens next.  Especially, how willKyoko continues to make her way to become a top actress, what happen to the relationship between Kyoko and Corn, did people recognize Kyoko's performance in Dark Moon as Mio...  All these questions are remain unknown.\n

Eternally selfless and loving Kyoko devoted her whole life to helping the man she loves achieve his dream of becoming a rock star. Only to one day overhear him bashing her opening admitting to using her and hitting on another woman. You know what they say, 
Hell Hath No Furry Like A Woman Scorn. Something inside her snaps (or rather opens in this case) and she is reborn a new person with an unquenchable thirst for revenge and demon minions to aid in her quest. Unable to get close enough to him to settle her vendetta Kyoko decides to enter show business so she canpersonally ruin his life the way her the former love of her life ruined hers.


Skip beat is surprisingly mature for a Shojo, walking the fine line between love and hate with tact and realism. It takes on fairly complex subjects but does so with lightheartedness and great sense of humor. At its core, it’s your standard coming of age story about a young woman discovering who she is. And Like your traditional, shojo there is still a romantic element to the story but, in many ways, that is secondary to Kyoko’s own personal journey. The character development is what really makes this anime so great; not just the star but all the characters are fully fleshed and well rounded. From self-centered rock star who broke her hear, to her reluctant best friend, to her flamboyant/eccentric boss, to the 8 occult loving 8 year old that haunts the talent agency, to the stoic workaholic movie star who becomes her new potential love interest all the charters endearing to watch. Even the career path Kyoko chooses (which I wont name to avoid spoilers) is presented in a way that will make the audience fall in love with it as much as Kyoko does.


The animation is solid with a lot of bright colors, although it does use the simplified chibiesqe character design for comedic effect occasionally.

The music is nothing to write home about; its neither impressive nor annoying, it simply serves as ambience.

As far as I know its only available in subs but the Japanese voice acting is great and there is an outstanding fan sub on youtube (just the first episode, sorry) that I invite anyone to check out.

Skip Beat can only be defined as a treat from the shoujo genre. When I watched this I remember thinking "How have I never even heard about this show?". Skip Beat is just another show that deserves hype but doesn't get it.
Skip Beat is about Kyouko who follows her childhood friend Sho to Tokyo when he becomes a music star. She dedicates her life to him but he only uses her and then tosses her aside. Kyouko not allowing herself to be thus insulted vows to get revenge by becoming more successful than him in the entertainment industry and begins acting for his company's competitor.


Story: 8

Yes this is yet another shoujo about being a star in Japan's entertainment industry but unlike others it focuses less on the idea of being a star and much more on what it means to be an actor or actress. The anime displays acting as an artform and applies to it the wonderful Japanese perspective of everything being beautiful. As an active participant in theatre myself I could really understand and admire Kyouko's love of acting. I could also appreciate how realistic the anime was in that it explained the characters actions in the present by showing what had happened in the past to make them that way.


Art: 8

The art is good just kinda awkward in some places but appeasing enough to the eye.


Sound: 10

The music is very good and compliments the anime. The voice acting is fantastic and really helps provoke emotion.


Characters: 10

The characters make this anime each of them grows and works through problems of the past and present. They are all strong characters and it's really easy to appreciate their struggles.

When I first started watching I didn't really like Kyouko. I remember thinking that she overreacted when Sho used her and that she should have just gone on with her life and that revenge was stupid. I also thought she was stupid for not realizing she was being used in the first place. But in the end I loved Kyouko because the anime explained to me why she had done all those things and while the reasons may have been stupid you could really sympathise with her. Kyouko is actually a great character she's determined, intelligent, strong, and just plain awesome for a shoujo lead.

I liked Ren right off the bat because he was so down to earth and you just don't find that kind of calm maturity in many shoujo. While he has problems he mostly settles them in the quietness of his mind rather than displaying them to the whole world. I also liked that while he was serious he was also kind and even though he doesn't really need to grow as a character he still does.

Sho is nothing but a spoiled teenager that you are set up and meant to hate but in an interesting twist of events I found myself actually caring about him. Rather than in most anime the antagonist is not clearly defined at first you think it's Sho but end up realizing its just life. Sho has common weaknesses that almost everyone struggles with and while those weaknesses originally make him the bad guy they are eventually twisted into making the audience sympathise with his struggles. In the end you realize that he isn't a bad person or character. This kind of well thought out deep and dynamic character is what makes this show good.

Anyway this show has awesome characters.


Enjoyment: 10

I really loved this anime. At first when the groundwork was being laid I didn't really know what to think and almost quit after the second episode but I'm really glad I didn't because its awesome. Part of what threw me off is the very Japanese sense of humor that was more extreme than I had ever seen but after I got used to it I would almost bust a gut laughing at every random hand coming from mouth clip (and there are quite a few of these). I have rewatched this two times and it never gets boring.


Overall: 9

This is definitely up in my top shoujos and even in my top ten overall anime. I liked it as much as fruits basket and in some ways more because the main character was more realistic. It has a good story and wonderful characters and should simply be watched and enjoyed.

This is one of my favorite animes for sure. It even got me into reading the manga by reading it. The manga however did a tailspin for me and I had to stop. Though honestly I would have loved to see a second season of this. They stayed pretty original to the manga. The style is even almost the same except a few anatomy fixes which is great. Despite that the anatomy is still a bit off but it's part of the charm. 
The animation holds up even after all these years though of course it still looks a bit dated. The anime itself isabout a girl following "the love of her life" to a big city and helping him get famous. That ends badly and it unlocks her pandora box of sorts and she wants revenge. So she joins acting and vowed to become more famous than him. 


It's honestly such a funny anime that you can't help but laugh. You fall in love with the main character though she does follow the typical tropes. Not very smart, clumsy, a bit of a crybaby at times. If you look at her traits on paper it's nothing special but when you watch the anime you notice things about her that make her completely unique. You want her to succeed and find her true calling. 


You end up rooting for her and watching a nice budding romance. The romance is what made me want a second season the most. Ren the brown haired male is by far one of my favorite characters and the way the two interact is beyond adorable and hilarious. It's a great anime from start to finish and it'll have you laughing and feeling for the girl. 


It's a wonderful adaption to the source material that will keep you entranced. If you loved the manga you will love this and if you love this then I suggest giving the manga a try though it is very long. Over all this is one of my favorite animes and I wouldn't mind watching it a 3rd time.

One word thats most fitting for this anime would be captivating.
Actually i was rather surprised by this anime. I posponed watching it for at least 2 years thinking I wont like it too much. Well, I couldnt be more wrong!
The Story:
The whole story revolves basically around 3 characters: Kyoko, our female MC, Ren, who is considered a great actor and last but not least Sho, who made his name in showbiz by singing.
Basically Kyoko, who is discribed as a wallflower by other co-workers lives pretty much only for Sho BUT thats going to change the moment she overhears what Sho really thinks about her. Thenshe wants revange, so she tries to become famous and actually manages to get into LME the same agency as actor Ren. So we follow her around as she tries to climb to the top and her feelings of revange start to get replaced by the love for acting and ofcourse her growing feelings for .......... :p (though for the last one you have to read the manga..)\n\n
Now to be honest i found episodes 2-4 a little bit annoying. The reason? How Kyoko got into the agency just didnt make any sense to me. But .. its an anime so I guess its to be expected not to be 100% realistic xD\n
But other than that I can mention just another 2 negative things about this anime:\n
1. No season 2 :'(\n
2. The anime stops exactly where the real romance actually starts, so that the romantic moments are rather rare.\n\n
BUT none of these points are that important (although I normally hate it if an romance anime has not enough romace)! \n
I personally think Skip Beat! is well made. I like the characters even the supporting cast was so funny and their feelings where relatable. There were moments I had to laugh, I was angry and I was completely captivated. I was so absorbed, when the ending music started (really like the song in English and Japanese^^) I felt like I was woken up from a trance like state xD I love animes where not only the male but also the female MC is talented, strong and smart. Kyoko definetely is all of the above! Especially after episode 13 or so I couldnt stop watching. Actually I finished Skip Beat the same day I started it. When Kyoko is acting, its something else. \n
You also see character developement not only between the 3 MCs but also with the supporting cast. The pace was perfect not too fast, not too slow.\n\n
If you want to know how this story ends just read the manga. I rarely read mangas mostly because Im too lazy and I easily get bored. Well guess what! With Skip Beat I never get bored. Its rather hard to stop reading :p I enjoyed the anime as well as the manga. (Also Rens backstory is rather intresting.)\n\n
Soooo if you're looking for a funny, slighty romantic, most of the time easy going and highly enjoyable anime to watch I highly recommend you this one!^^

The plot and characters were awesome! This storyline wasn't very outstanding but the author managed to capture my attention and keep it there. At first I had thought that this was going to be heavy on the romance  with a lot of parts where the main character would humiliate herself in front of her love interest. I was wrong!
     Even though the story did include romance, the main point was more about life and what true acting was. I believe the author did really well with the story and made it into something new and unseen before. The art wasvery good, and the characters were drawn extremely well, the main characters were all so cool and beautiful! (Especially Tsuruga Ren and Fuwa Sho) I really loved the artist's drawing style because the people looked real at some points but sometimes their faces were like little blobs, that was part of what made it so hilarious. Many of the outfits and items were absolutely gorgeous and the detail included was beautiful.\n
    I liked how instead of a cute, slightly dumb, but treated nicely be everyone the main character Kyouko was tough, wacko,extremely scary,very childish, but a person who would work hard for her goal. (Even though it was a bad one)\n
     I loved this anime and it is one of my favorites, I would recommend this for people who love seeing the main characters kick butt and have fun doing it.

This anime is one pleasant surprise. I was not really looking forward to watching it, especially with a somewhat boring title, but I was curious because of the high scores given in the reviews.
Sound: 7 - There are 2 OP and ED songs and they were catchy enough. Background music was just okay for me also.
Story/Art : 8 - At first, this would be a story of revenge. However, as the it progresses, it becomes a story of self-fulfillment and self-realization. The characters were pretty in an unconventional sort of way. All the men seem to have long limbs and long faces. The women werefrom cute to sexy (but not offensive). I love the 'chibi' parts because it makes the scenes funnier.


Characters/Enjoyment: 9 - We learn a lot about the main characters - their personality traits, weaknesses, (little) history - and that is what makes it so engrossing. The voice actors did a beautiful job since the 'acting' parts will really suck you in and make you feel that they were indeed actors. Those scenes were moving.


Overall: 8 - I loved it, yes! I guess, I scored it an 8 because of the ending. Though, it was just right since you would definitely want more. For me, I simply did not want it to end... not at the 25th episode, at least. I might just pick up the manga... :)
